content.title: Intro
content.content:
2023
Preceded by
2023
2024
Year
2025
Followed by
2025

Tolkien-related events that took place in 2024.

content.title: January
content.content:
1 - All of Tolkien writings that were published during his lifetime enters in public domain in countries where copyright expires in 50 years after the author's death, in countries of Africa and Asia such as in Egypt and China, and in other countries such us New Zealand and Belarus.
3 - Birthday Toast.

content.title: February
content.content: 23 - It is announced that the online videogame The Lord of the Rings: Heroes of Middle-earth will be discontinued online.

content.title: March
content.content:
25 - Tolkien Reading Day.
28 - Release of Christopher Tolkien Centenary Boxed Sets #2

content.title: May
content.content:
5 - Actor Bernard Hill, who portrayed Theoden in The Lord of the Rings (film series), dies.
24 - The online videogame The Lord of the Rings: Heroes of Middle-earth is discontinued online.

content.title: July
content.content:
4 - Release of Christopher Tolkien Centenary Boxed Sets #3
18 - Release of Tolkien Calendar 2025

content.title: August
content.content:
15 - Release of Christopher Tolkien Centenary Boxed Sets #4
29 - The second season of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power is expected to be released.
29 - 1 September - Oxonmoot 2024 is held.

content.title: September
content.content: 12 - Release of The Collected Poems of J.R.R. Tolkien

content.title: December
content.content: 13 - The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim is scheduled to be released in cinemas.[1]

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ Anthony D'Alessandro, ‘Lord Of The Rings: The War Of The Rohirrim’ Release Delayed Until December 2024, DEADLINE, 2 January 2024.
